result.execSummary:
The defendant Marguerite E Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1a.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay fine/costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Pay $1,175.76 Joint & Several with co-defendant(s) and to be paid during her term of probation.  
Restitution held open if changes need be made.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  
Apology letter to be given to agent first.  
No contact with Eric Drewek, unless approved by agent.

Defendant Marguerite E Tompkins in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Marguerite E Tompkins in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls case at 8:36 a.m.  Matter is being heard for sentencing after revocation.
Parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. 
State has complied with victim notification requirements.
DA Molepski informs the Court of the facts for revocation of probation and requests sentencing of 9 mo jail each on Counts 1 & 2 concurrent.
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments and informs of possible programing option, if not then request 6 mo jail. 

BTC:****SAR***
Count 1: 943.41(3)(a):  9 mo jail,, credit 105 days, with huber for work, counseling, and any other reason the Sheriff will allow. No home monitoring. 
Pay restitution $1,175.76 JP Morgan-Chase Bank. 
Pay costs. 

Count 2: 943.41(5)(a)1a: 9 mo jail, concurrent with Count 1. Same huber.
Pay costs.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-01-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Marguerite E Tompkins in court with attorney Sean Drury. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  w/h sentence: 12 mo probation: 30 community services,   Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.  Apology letter to be given to agent first.  Rest $1,175.76 J/S co-defendants - Andrea Ozman to be paid during her term of probation.  Restitution held open if changes need be made.  No contact with Eric Drewek, unless approved by agent.  Pay Ct 1$150 fine + costs. and Ct 2 973.015 expungment if all costs/fine and compliance with probation conditions.  Dismiss ct 3.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: no contest to Ct 1 and 2
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty ct 1 & 2 .  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Ct 3 DRI

ADA Cousins makes statements in support of agreement.
Atty Drury concurs in part and requests smaller fine and expungement option.

Rest $1,175.76 J/S co-defendants - Andrea Ozman to be paid during her term of probation.  Restitution held open if changes need be made.  No contact with Eric Drewek, unless approved by agent. Plea hearing on July 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Written
Pre-trial conference on June 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant and Atty Drury present.  DA Molepski present for the State.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
